definition: to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together

sentences.english: Some incidents did end in violence, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然有些事件最終演變成了惡鬥。

sentences.english: After a fierce fight, Robin killed Guy.
sentences.chinese: 經過一番惡鬥，羅賓漢殺死了蓋伊。

sentences.english: A bigger crowd, in other words, was more likely to suppress a fight.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，人越多，越有可能抑制一場惡鬥。

sentences.english: The badger and the snake had a ferocious battle in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 獾和蛇在樹林裏進行了一場惡鬥。

sentences.english: Lin was explicitly, yellow rate with baylor scattered on armed.
sentences.chinese: 林被罷官，黃率民團與貝勒展開惡鬥。

sentences.english: There is a very serious fight going on in Ukraine between government forces and rebels.
sentences.chinese: 烏克蘭政府軍和反對派正在惡鬥。

sentences.english: Two battles evil, life and death Competing, naturally climax of the film office.
sentences.chinese: 兩惡惡鬥，生死相搏，自是本片最高潮之處。

sentences.english: No one wants bloody fights, so they keep their prizes.
sentences.chinese: 大家都不想血腥惡鬥，所以他們會保住戰利品。

sentences.english: We'll face a tough fight in the upcoming election.
sentences.chinese: 在即將到來的選舉中，我們將面臨一場惡鬥。

sentences.english: Then one night there was a fight right out on Tremont Street.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，在華埠街上發生了一場惡鬥。

definition: lit. the dragon wars, the tiger battles (idiom); fierce battle between giants
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
Lien Chan (1936-), Taiwanese politician, former vice-president and chairman of Guomintang
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to fight with all one's might
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
